data.title: Great burgers, onion rings and shakes
data.text: This place has a great, fun diner feeling.  While not fancy they are superb at what they do, that being burgers, shakes, fries and onion rings.  We had very good service as well.

data.title: Burgers and shakes
data.text: This restaurant is an Auburn fixture, been here over 20 years.  The best is the burgers and fries.  If you want a treat the shakes are great.

data.title: Soooo good!!
data.text: Let me start by saying I am not a burger lover...but based on recommendations from family we decided to try the place out. My burger was very good, and the fries were perfectly cooked...but my very favorite thing was the fried mushrooms!!  They were amazing!!  Finished off the meal with custom flavored milkshakes that can't be beat. We will be back!!😍

data.title: FRESH FRIED MUSHROOMS!!!
data.text: I actually went here because they had fresh fried mushrooms, which are hard to find.  most places serve frozen ones, which do not compare.  The hamburgers were delicious, you create your own, with some unusual topping.  Onion rings were great and hand cut French fries too.  I know not the best place for the dieter.  But definitely a great place for a splurge.  I was told the milkshakes are incredible too, but I did not have one of those.  Staff was very friendly.

data.title: Great family place
data.text: Every time my family comes into town they have to eat here! They love that they can get whatever they want on their burgers. The fry order is huge. One order can feed 4 people easily.

data.title: has lost some of its edge
data.text: This place was fantastic during my college days here. upon my last visit, I was surprised that it has lost so much of its uniqueness. I know most the people there now have no idea about the cheeseburger skit from saturday nigh live, but they have just become another burger place, food is still pretty good

data.title: Good place for a custom burger
data.text: I came in one day after a long bike ride looking for a quick lunch and got a great burger with awesome fries and onion rings. The restaurant is an older establishment but it has been well kept and clean. I built my own burger and you have a huge variety of choices as to how to dress your burger, but if your are indecisive they have themed burger for you to choice from! Will definitely return!

data.title: Homemade Fries and cheeeezzzzy burgers!
data.text: If you love homemade fries and cheeseburgers, hello, you have found the place to go! This is a great place just for that! Family friendly and yummy!

data.title: Cheeseburger salad?!
data.text: I'm doing low carb so I thought Oh I'll just have a burger with no bun but then I saw it... cheeseburger topping option for your salad! . You got to choose whatever you wanted in your salad they even had green olives! It sounds weird but it was very filling and quite tasty. The onion rings looked amazing as did the burgers, fries, and milkshakes everyone had at the table.  It's a small place with a 50's dinner feel.  We enjoyed it as well as Auburn.  Such a quaint town.

data.title: Lunch while visting Auburn University
data.text: Great atmosphere and decent burgers.  We ordered a large fry to go along with them and took more than half home, so come hungry.

data.title: Usually Very Tasty
data.text: We've been here several times and usually have a good burger & great milkshakes. This time our buns were hard, but still gave it 4 stars because it's still worth returning to.

data.title: I just didn't see what all the hype was about
data.text: The only good thing about the burgers is you can choose your toppings but the place is very loud, cramped and the food was mediocre, not worth the visit!

data.title: Pounder challenge!
data.text: Husband & son did the pounder challenge and ate every bite! Their picture is on the wall. There are also hamburgers, wraps, etc. for smaller appetites. You have many toppings to choose.  The fries and ring combo basket will feed everyone at the table. Shakes are delicious!

data.title: Good Family Restaurant in Auburn
data.text: After walking down to Toomers Corner after an Auburn football game my 10 year old son and I stopped in here for burger after looking in a couple of other places and deciding they were overcrowded and full of too many college kids having a "good time".  They had about a 25-30 minute wait so we ate at the bar.  Service was excellent.  The burgers were great and fully customizable with a variety of toppings.  Also ordered fries/ring combo and they were also very good as well.  The highlight for my 10 year old was the large number of milkshakes options you could order.  They also do take-out (saw a number of people doing this) as well as serve beer if you want one after the game.  Overall this seems like a good family spot to go to with quality food at an affordable price.

data.title: Old Favorite For A Reason
data.text: Any one ready for a burger in Auburn ready for a quality meal probably knows about this legend - and for good reasons! Our recent visit was a pleasure - burgers were great, quality meat patty, prepared with fresh ingredients; all staff were friendly and eager to make our stop enjoyable.

data.title: Fun Game Day tradition
data.text: this is one of my daughter's favorites.  We try to eat here at least a couple of times during football season. It is always worth the wait.   Good burgers and fries.  We usually can't eat it all.  There are lots of choices to build your meal just the way you want it.

data.title: Great burgers and shakes!!
data.text: The burgers taste great and they have an awesome variety of toppings for burgers.  Their onion rings are wonderful!!  I could skip the burger and just eat the onion rings!  The s'mores milkshake tasted like heaven!  This is always my favorite restaurant when visiting Auburn and it is well worth the wait after the football game!!

data.title: Fun Place to Eat
data.text: I enjoyed by meal here. They have a wide arrangements of condiments to add to your hamburger. The french fries and onion rings were served hot and cooked to perfection. Will return here on my next trip to Auburn.

data.title: Break your diet for this meal!
data.text: Honestly didn't know what to expect because I have never been to this restaurant chain. This location is located on college campus of Auburn, Alabama. It has a 50's flair to decor. Since the night I visited it was $1 specials on basket of fries/onion rings. I ordered the usual- which was a cheeseburger and the toppings you wanted. I also ordered fries & a milkshake. They used edys brand ice cream and they have 100 combinations of shakes...no joke! Chocolate was my choice and very good! Worth the grease and hot fries ...good service too! Also they have a food challenge that you can get a pic of yourself on wall. It is for adults and a separate challenge for 12 and under.

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: Great Burgers!  They also have excellent onion rings and milkshakes!  My only negative comment is that they serve Pepsi products.  They also have a really good grilled chicken sandwich.
